meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unwholesome or unhealthy.
meanings.sent1: The insalubrity of the water in the pond made it unsafe to swim in.
meanings.sent2: The insalubrity of the air in the old building caused many people to feel sick.
meanings.sent3: Despite the insalubrity of the food at the fair, people still lined up to try it.
meanings.sent4: The insalubrity of the environment was like a dark cloud hanging over the town.
meanings.sent5: The insalubrity of the conditions was so severe that it was impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: A condition of being detrimental to health or well-being.
meanings.sent1: The insalubrity of the neighborhood led to many residents moving away.
meanings.sent2: The insalubrity of the workplace environment caused a rise in employee sick days.
meanings.sent3: The insalubrity of the situation was so absurd that it almost seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The insalubrity of the relationship between the two countries was evident in their tense interactions.
meanings.sent5: The insalubrity of the atmosphere created a sense of unease among the community members.
